title: Civilization
author: Emile Zola
content: Civilization will not attain perfection until the last stone, from the last church, falls on the last priest.

title: Community
author: Joshua Bloch
content: When you choose a language, you're choosing more than a set of technical trade-offs - You're choosing a community.

title: Throwing Code
author: Ken Thompson
content: One of my most productive days was throwing away 1,000 lines of code.

title: Understandable Code
author: Martin Fowler
content: Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.

title: Every Village
author: Victor Hugo
content: There is in every village a torch: The schoolteacher and an extinguisher: The priest

title: Enough is Enough
author: Richard Dawkins
content: The time has come for people of reason to say: Enough is Enough! Religious faith discourages independent thought, it's divisive and it's dangerous.

title: In the Future
author: Popular Mechanics
content: Computers in the future may weigh no more than 1.5 tons.
description: Forecasting the relentless march of science in 1949

title: Debugging
author: Andrew Singer
content: The art of debugging is figuring out what you really told your program to do rather than what you thought you told it to do.

title: More Intelligent
author: Robert Ingersoll
content: As people become more intelligent, they care less for preachers and more for teachers.

title: Thinking Computers
author: Edsger W. Dijkstra
content: The question of whether computers can think is like the question of whether submarines can swim.

title: Mystery Blanket
author: Barry Taylor
content: God is the blanket we throw over mystery to give it shape

title: Great Habits
author: Kent Beck
content: I’m not a great programmer. I’m just a good programmer with great habits.

title: Zero-Sum Game
author: John Carmack
content: Programming is not a zero-sum game. Teaching something to a fellow programmer doesn't take it away from you. I'm happy to share what I can, because I'm in it for the love of programming.

title: Less Examined
author: Thomas Paine
content: The bible is a book that has been read more, and examined less, than any book that ever existed.

title: No Coincidence
author: Jeremy S. Anderson
content: There are two major products that come out of Berkeley: LSD and UNIX. We don’t believe this to be a coincidence.

title: Absurdities
author: Voltaire
content: Those who can make you believe absurdities can make you commit artrocities

title: World Market
author: Thomas Watson
content: I think there is a world market for maybe five computers.

title: Happiness
author: Anne (After Life)
content: Happiness is amazing! It's so amazing it doesn't matter if it's yours or not.

title: Requirements
author: Sam Saccone
content: 99.7% of software development in one requirement. A user should be able to view a list of items.

title: Divide and Conquer
author: Bjarne Stroustrup
content: The most fundamental problem in software development is complexity. There is only one basic way of dealing with complexity: divide and conquer

title: Fear vs Courage
author: Robert Ingersoll
content: Fear believes — courage doubts. Fear falls upon the earth and prays — courage stands erect and thinks. Fear retreats — courage advances. Fear is barbarism — courage is civilization. Fear believes in witchcraft, in devils and in ghosts. Fear is religion, courage is science.

title: Intelligence
author: Bertrand Russell
content: So far as I can remember, there’s not one word in the Gospels in praise of intelligence.

title: A fad
author: Prentice Hall
content: I have traveled the length and breadth of this country and talked with the best people, and I can assure you that data processing is a fad that won't last out the year.
description: The editor in charge of business books for Prentice Hall, 1957

title: Natural Resource
author: Alan Kay
content: The Internet was done so well that most people think of it as a natural resource like the Pacific Ocean, rather than something that was man-made. When was the last time a technology with a scale like that was so error-free?

title: Meaning of Life
author: Unknown
content: The realization that you were not created with a purpose does not mean your life has no meaning. It just means you get to find your own.

title: Basis for morality
author: Frank Herbert
content: Respect for the truth comes close to being the basis for all morality.

title: Berömdheter
author: Vilhelm Moberg
content: Av intet skapade Gud världen. TV tillverkar berömdheter av samma material.

title: Stärk det goda
author: Zarathustra
content: Den som stärker det goda, var han än finner det, uträttar ett verkligt arbete på jorden.

title: Good Code
author: Steve McConnell
content: Good code is its own best documentation.

title: Father of Knowledge
author: Hippocrates
content: Science is the father of knowledge, but opinion breeds ignorance.

title: Virtuous Men
author: Bertrand Russell
content: One is often told that it is a very wrong thing to attack religion, because religion makes men virtuous. So I am told; I have not noticed it.

title: Being Offensive
author: Linus Torvalds
content: I like being outrageous at times. I like offending people because I think people who get offended should be offended.

title: Bad Reasoning
author: Sam Harris
content: Religion has made bad reasoning into an art form.

title: Claims vs Evidence
author: Carl Sagan
content: Extraordinary claims require extraordinary evidence

title: Force for Atheism
author: Isaac Asimov
content: Properly read, the bible is the most potent force for atheism ever conceived.

title: Data
author: Gary Schubert & Cliff Stoll
content: Data is not information. Information is not knowledge. Knowledge is not understanding. Understanding is not wisdom.

title: Fear Death?
author: Epicurus
content: Why should I fear death? If I am, death is not.If death is, I am not. Why should I fear that which cannot exist when I do?

title: Ony Excuse
author: Frederich Nietzsche
content: Stendahl robbed me of the best atheist joke which precisely I could have made: God's only excuse is that he does not exist.

title: Problem of Evil
author: Epicurus
content: Is God willing to prevent evil, but not able? Then he is not omnipotent. Is he able, but not willing? Then he is malevolent. Is he both able and willing? Then whence cometh evil? Is he neither able nor willing? Then why call him God?

title: Easy Confidence
author: Mark Twain
content: The easy confidence with which I know another man's religion is folly teaches me to suspect that my own is also

title: Livet
author: Lennart Hagefors
content: Livet är det som pågår medan vi sysslar med annat.

title: Simplicity
author: Tony Hoare
content: There are two methods of software design. One is to make the program so simple, there are obviously no errors. The other is to make it so complicated, there are no obvious errors.

title: Eliminating Fear
author: Eric Elliott
content: TDD eliminates fear of the merge button. That reassuring coverage number gives your whole team the confidence to stop gatekeeping every little change to the codebase and let changes thrive. Removing fear of change is like oiling a machine.

title: Programmer Virtues
author: Larry Wall
content: Most of you are familiar with the virtues of a programmer. There are three, of course: laziness, impatience, and hubris.

title: Software Today
author: Alan Kay
content: Most software today is very much like an Egyptian pyramid with millions of bricks piled on top of each other, with no structural integrity, but just done by brute force and thousands of slaves.

title: Programming
author: Chris Pine
content: Programming isn’t about what you know; it’s about what you can figure out.

title: Development Time
author: Tom Cargill
content: The first 90% of the code accounts for the first 90% of the development time. The remaining 10% of the code accounts for the other 90% of the development time.

title: Belief
author: Isaac Asimov
content: Imagine the people who believe such things and who are not ashamed to ignore, totally, all the patient findings of thinking minds through all the centuries since the Bible was written. And it is these ignorant people, the most uneducated, the most unimaginative, the most unthinking among us, who would make themselves the guides and leaders of us all; who would force their feeble and childish beliefs on us; who would invade our schools and libraries and homes. I personally resent it bitterly.

title: Floating Point Arithmetic
author: Tom Scott
content: Some programmers, when confronted with a problem, think "I know, I'll use floating point arithmetic." Now they have 1.999999999997 problems.

title: Patents
author: Linus Torvalds
content: The bulk of all patents are crap. Spending time reading them is stupid. It’s up to the patent owner to do so, and to enforce them.

title: Civilized Man
author: Robert Ingersoll
content: Religion has not civilized man - man has civilized religion.
